page.title: 16CHANGING TIMES - TIDMARSH
page.content: Local people feel that because traffic has increased the area is noisier. There are more outsiders as commuters from Reading and London have bought houses, particularly since the building of the M4 motorway. There have also been many changes in th countryside. In the last 20 years myxamatosis killed many rabbits and Dutch Elm desease has killed the trees. New trees were planted in 1983. The bus service has been taken off because too few people used them. The majority of the residents own private cars. The greater volume of traffic in recent years has led to the widening of single lane tracks. One of the complaints of the residents is the shortage of street lights.
